subject: Dear friend,
body:
Dear friend,
It is my pleasure to write to you concerning an offer if your interest would be trustworthy. Within the ESKOM South Africa Energy Company where I work as a Director of Audit and Project Implementation, I have in my possession unsettled payment in USD funds. The funds represent a certain percentage of the total contract value executed in my Department by a foreign firm which I over-invoiced to the amount of USD12,700,000.00 (Twelve Million Seven Hundred Thousand United States Dollar). While the actual contract cost has been paid to the original contractor leaving the overbilling amount unspecified and/or uncredited.
I am seeking your cooperation to present you as the beneficiary of the over-valuation [USD12,700,000.00] since I'm not permitted to operate foreign bank account. Change of beneficiary information upon application for claim to reflect payment in your name will be secured with great supervision and control. I propose that should you be willing to come on board in this project, your share for participation will be (35%), and the remaining(65%) will be for me. The business is completely safe from risk provided you handle it with utmost confidentiality. It does not matter whether you and/or your company does a contract project meaning your area of specialization won't be a hindrance for actualizing this project.
I have reposed my confidence in you and I hope you won't let me down, thank you for your anticipated cooperation.
Yours sincerely,
Peter Woodlands

subject: Re:   Dear friend,
body:
Dear Peter Woodlands,

Thank you for your email and the business proposal. I am interested in learning more about this opportunity. However, I would like to understand more about the nature of the contract and why it was left unsettled.

Could you please provide me with more details about the project? Also, could you clarify what my responsibilities would be in this arrangement?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Delores

subject: Re: Dear friend,
body:
Dear Delores,



Thank you for your email, I really appreciate your response to my
proposition.

This is to inform you that after a rigorous verification process a verdict
was reached to grant you the sole beneficiary status and rightfully claim
the life insurance funds of separate value because the married couples had
individual life insurance covers for each partner. In furtherance to the
life insurance inheritance funds, the payment was already made out to the
spouse, because as at the time of her husband’s demise, she was in a coma
for a few days and later recovered but passed on during the recovery stages
probably from grief.



A very sad tale of the couple and summarizes the reason for this next line
of action regarding this payment. The insurance company already worked out
the payment to spouse and wrote out a check in her favour and subsequently
vice versa to avoid anomalies with the accounting. However, for this
insurance payment to be released to a third party outside beneficiary
status or official kinship outside the contents of the insurance policy
documents, legalization process consisting of Stamp Duty Assessment and
Affidavit Oath respectively. Which must be registered here in England and
under direct supervision of His Majesty’s High Crown Court, with which I
will attach the necessary forms in my next email.



In addition, the Indemnity of Rights Privilege Form is the official
communique containing the legality directives regarding this procedure.
Therefore, making it highly imperative that you adhere to these directives
in ensuring the immediate release of this insurance pay out. Furthermore,
the initial payment issued in the form of bank draft to the deceased wife
prior to her demise was recalled and replaced with an interstate bank draft
issued by the assigned paying bank on behalf of Insurance Company to show
the funds are still readily available for claim upon compliance with the
legal directives outlined in this email.
Regards,



Peter Woodlands
